intro: Rhaponticum carthamoides subsp. carthamoides, commonly known as the common rhapontic, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 1 to 2 meters, featuring robust stems and large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy yellow flowers arranged in a composite head, which are borne on long, slender peduncles. Its leaves are usually hairy and have a distinctive heart-shaped base. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along riverbanks.
